results.title: Openly in the city
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: Two different approaches to the problem of educating mentally handicapped children. The first is based on the premise that the children need guidance in personality development as well as basic educational skills, in order that they may gain an identity, and thus an idea of their place in society. The second approach involves perfecting certain skills through structured programs, in the belief that the individual will develop as he masters skills Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Opening speech: McLaren = Discours de bienvenue de Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: An animated film in which Norman McLaren is caught by his own film tricks. He attempts to welcome the audience but is frustrated by a reluctant microphone that has a will of its own. Originally made for the official opening of the Montreal Film Festival. (Awards: London) Contains both French and English dialogue.

results.title: Open your eyes
results.creator_credit: Carol Hale, Girl Scouts of the USA and Ed Schultz
results.brief_description: Describes the kinds of effective service which senior girl scouts can give to their communities in small towns and in big cities. Explains that the projects of these teenage girls are related to such subjects as poverty, conservation, disadvantaged pre-school children, Native American affairs, and the physically handicapped.

results.title: Open university: the curriculum - context, design and development course
results.creator_credit: Gwyn Pritchard, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: The concept of openness in higher education is examined. The film looks at the Open Admissions Policy at the City University of New York. It focuses on the implications for a university of having an open admissions policy. In particular the film examines how the abandonment of traditional selection practices affects the curriculum of the university.

results.title: Open today
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Scottish Tourist Board
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 45th year of Scotland’s Garden Scheme, the film shows a selection of gardens as far apart as Dalkeith, Ullspool and Wester Ross.

results.title: Open to view: British country houses
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures and John Durst
results.brief_description: Some of the historic castles and houses of Britain. The island castle of St Michael’s Mount in Cornwall; Stokesay Castle in Shropshire; the great house at Chastleton; Chatsworth, where the Dukes of Devonshire have gathered art treasures; Castle Code in Northern Ireland. A visit to Windsor Castle.

results.title: Open to the Sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. Where the river meets the sea, new designs in environmental geography appear

results.title: Open sesame: Dubrovnik
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Joe O'Brien
results.brief_description: Dubrovnik lies at the centre of Yugoslavia’s tourist development which stretches for over a hundred miles of sea coast. The United Nations representative works to preserve the natural wild beauty of the Adriatic Coast and the man-made beauty of the ancient white stone buildings and monuments.
